author: Douglas Zimmerman
title: The best places to see fall foliage in Northern California this year
text:
Northern California's fall colors are arriving right on time and they'll be beautiful, according to California Fall Color, a crowdsourced leaf-peeping website. This year's California fall foliage season in the eastern Sierra is starting out with a flourish. "I think the season is pretty much on track," said Lara Kaylor, the editor and publisher of California Fall Color, a crowdsourced website that provides the most up-to-date information on fall foliage conditions throughout the state. "I think we're in for a really beautiful show in eastern Sierra for the next few weeks."
A mid-September cold snap in the mountains helped kick off the transition to fall, with temperatures plunging below freezing and snow accumulating on the highest peaks.
"It definitely got things moving," said Kaylor. "And there are areas in the eastern Sierra that are starting to be near peak."

Fall colors appear near Sagehen Summit, Calif., on Sept. 16, 2024. Samantha Lindberg / Mammoth Lakes Tourism
Her website is the most current leaf-peeping resource in California thanks to a network of more than 100 contributors who report on and photograph the leaves changing colors. Kaylor encourages all fall foliage admirers in the state to contribute directly so she can share the very best information.
"It's cool, in today's age of AI and computer-generated stuff, that this site still operates on boots on the ground and people's eyes on the trees and what you're seeing out there," she said.
California's fall color season is a completely different experience from what you find along the East Coast of the United States, Kaylor noted. In this state, leaf peepers have to search out pockets of foliage to find fall colors, often set against dramatic mountain backdrops, while on the East Coast they can view entire hillsides of fall color relatively easily.
